oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. Elizabeth MB Church Lodge: food stand
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: St. Elizabeth Missionary Baptist Church, Lodge, and Cemetery

Black and white photograph of a small white wood structure associated with the llodge?school. Screens and openwindows around the perimeter of the structure; signs advertising food and prices on the front facade

This historic congregation and meeting place dates to the spring of 1865 when Josiah Murray, a local landowner, gave lands to his emancipated slaves for a church and cemetery. The present church building dates to the late 20th century but the historic lodge/school dates to the late 19th-early 20th century.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee;
